item.title: HP has announced a new promotion offering free roaming Wi-Fi for specific notebooks and tablets
item.description:
HP and iPass, the largest Wi-Fi network globally, recently revealed a partnership. Select HP laptops and tablets will now offer access to the iPass network. Source: HP website. This collaboration aims to provide users in Asia Pacific and Japan (APJ) with easier and more budget-friendly internet access both locally and during their travels. Customers purchasing new HP laptops and tablets with this feature will enjoy automatic access to millions of hotspots on the iPass network for a year, free of charge, upon registration...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/hp-has-announced-a-new-promotion-offering-free-roaming-wi-fi-for-specific-notebooks-and-tablets/

item.title: Fujitsu introduces 30 new models of enterprise PCs
item.description:
Fujitsu, along with Fujitsu Client Computing, has introduced 30 new enterprise PC models across 15 product lines. These models all feature the Windows 10 Creators Update, the most recent version of the Windows 10 operating system. Source: Fujitsu. The ESPRIMO K557/R desktop. Within its Fujitsu Desktop ESPRIMO line, five models are being released, including the ESPRIMO K557/R. This model boasts a redesigned chassis with an integrated LCD display. The high-quality IPS LCD is available in various sizes, ranging from 19...

item.title: The Pro Series from HP is effective for small and medium-sized businesses
item.description:
HP has introduced a new line of Pro Series desktops, notebooks, and an all-in-one (AiO) PC tailored for businesses of all sizes, particularly small- and medium-sized businesses (SMBs). Serena Yong, Managing Director of HP Singapore, highlighted the challenges faced by businesses in making technology decisions with limited budgets and IT resources. She emphasized that the HP BusinessNow program aims to provide support and access to solutions like the HP Pro Series...

item.title: The HP 2 in 1 printer is perfect for home offices
item.description:
HP has introduced a new PC and printer designed for home offices. The HP Pavilion x2, available in Singapore starting in October from S$499, offers a stylish and practical solution. This versatile device functions as a 10-inch Windows tablet and easily transforms into a fully functional laptop. It features a detachable magnetic keyboard cover that doubles as both a screen protector and a multi-position stand. Equipped with an Intel Atom processor, the Pavilion x2 boasts front-facing speakers with DTS sound and a battery life of up to 11...

item.title: Transfer files from your phone without using up your mobile data
item.description:
Xender, a Chinese app, simplifies phone-based file sharing without incurring mobile data costs using peer-to-peer technology. For device-to-device transfers, Xender creates a local Wi-Fi hotspot that nearby users can join. This allows for the seamless sharing of photos, music, files, and apps between phones, proving particularly useful when upgrading to a new device. Xender boasts unlimited file sizes, cross-platform compatibility, and transfer speeds up to 50 times faster than Bluetooth...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/transfer-files-from-your-phone-without-using-up-your-mobile-data/

item.title: HP's Elite business PCs excel in performance, productivity, and security
item.description:
HP has introduced its latest Elite business PCs, including the exceptionally thin and light HP EliteBook 705 series, an all-in-one (AiO) model, and a refreshed desktop lineup featuring the world’s smallest business-class desktop. Serena Yong, Managing Director of HP Singapore, highlighted the demand for high-end Elite notebook innovation to be extended to a wider range of employees and devices. HP’s response is the Elite 705 and 800 Series PCs, which bring sleek design, enhanced collaboration features, and robust security to mainstream business devices...

item.title: The Office of the Future at HP is filled with cutting-edge innovation
item.description:
HP has introduced new products and services designed to help businesses create a modern and secure “Office of the Future.” This initiative focuses on empowering employees with technology that boosts productivity and creativity, while also offering flexibility in how and where they work. This shift is driven by evolving workforce demographics, as over 70% of Asian employees already work remotely and Millennials and Gen Z, who prioritize workplace flexibility, are becoming the majority...

item.title: Dell introduces an improved range of PCs for both consumer and commercial markets
item.description:
Dell debuted groundbreaking personal computing innovations at the annual Consumer Electronics Show (CES) in the US. They also updated their XPS, Inspiron, and Alienware consumer lines. Their OptiPlex, Latitude, and Precision commercial products received upgrades to 7th Gen Intel Core processors, USB-C with Thunderbolt 3 connectivity, and new professional graphics from NVIDIA and AMD. Dell’s monitor lineup also saw a refresh. The new Dell PC portfolio is equipped with Windows 10 and 7th Gen Intel Core processors, designed to maximize user productivity and creativity...

item.title: Access PC or Mac applications from iOS and Android devices
item.description:
Source: Parallels website. Parallels has launched an updated version of its Parallels Access app for iOS and Android. The app allows for remote access to both PCs and Macs, letting users access files and run applications while on the move. With Parallels Access, mobile devices can remotely utilize applications, edit documents, and search through files on a connected computer. Users can connect to any computer through a web browser without needing additional plugins or extensions...

item.description:
